intro: Ouratea kanukuensis, commonly known as the Kanuku ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America, particularly in regions with high humidity and well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
